sections.title: COMMIT
sections.text: COMMIT â€” commit the current transaction

sections.title: Synopsis
sections.text:
CODE:

COMMIT [ WORK | TRANSACTION ] [ AND [ NO ] CHAIN ]

sections.title: Description
sections.text: COMMITcommits the current transaction. All changes made by the transaction become visible to others and are guaranteed to be durable if a crash occurs.

sections.title: Parameters
sections.text:
Optional key words. They have no effect.
IfAND CHAINis specified, a new transaction is immediately started with the same transaction characteristics (seeSET TRANSACTION) as the just finished one. Otherwise, no new transaction is started.

sections.title: Notes
sections.text:
UseROLLBACKto abort a transaction.
IssuingCOMMITwhen not inside a transaction does no harm, but it will provoke a warning message.COMMIT AND CHAINwhen not inside a transaction is an error.

sections.title: Examples
Compatibility
sections.text: The commandCOMMITconforms to the SQL standard. The formCOMMIT TRANSACTIONis a PostgreSQL extension.
